page.title: 08Holyoake House
page.content: I went to Holyoake House and inteviewed Mrs Knox the owner. First she took me into the kitchen where she showed me the meat hooks and there was one cream hook. Then we went outside the house and Mrs Knox told me that you can tell how wealthy the builder was by how much timber there was in the front of the house. It is a timber framed house with wattle and daub infilling. The man who built the house was Thomas Holyoake and that was why the house was called Holyoake house. The house was built in 1630.Mr and Mrs Knox did not inherit the house they bought it from an agent. They have lived there for three years.It is a small farm with a big farm house split into two.Another family live in the other half of the house.
